content.description: To investigate hospital costs for pets in a certain state, researchers selected a random sample of 46 owners of parrots who had recently taken their parrot to an animal hospital for care. The cost of the visit for each parrot owner was recorded and used to create the 95 percent confidence interval <math alttext="62 dollars and 63 cents, plus or minus 17 dollars and 64 cents" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>62.63</mn><mo>Â±</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>17.64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following is a correct interpretation of the interval?

choices.label: We are 95 percent confident that the mean cost of a hospital visit for all parrot owners in the state is between $44.99 and $80.27.
We are 95 percent confident that the mean cost of a hospital visit for the parrot owners in the sample is between $44.99 and $80.27.
For all parrot owners in the state, 95 percent of hospital visits for parrot care cost between $44.99 and $80.27.
There is a 0.95 probability that the mean cost of a hospital visit for all parrot owners in the state is between $44.99 and $80.27.
There is a 0.95 probability that the mean cost of a hospital visit for the parrot owners in the sample is between $44.99 and $80.27.

content.answer: We are 95 percent confident that the mean cost of a hospital visit for all parrot owners in the state is between $44.99 and $80.27.

topic.text: 7.3: Justifying a Claim About a Population Mean Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
